title: MLB draft winners and head-scratchers: What we loved -- and didn't -- on Day 1
content: The first 105 picks are in the books. With shocks at Nos. 1 and 2, here are the winners, losers and takeaways.

title: Nats surprise at top of draft with SS Willits
content: The Nationals took high school shortstop Eli Willits with the No. 1 pick in the MLB draft, while Tyler Bremner went No. 2 to the Angels and LSU's Kade Anderson to the Mariners at No. 3.

title: Chelsea wins CWC as Palmer double stuns PSG
content: Cole Palmer produced a scintillating first-half masterclass as Chelsea demolished Paris Saint-Germain 3-0 to win the Club World Cup final at New Jersey's MetLife Stadium on Sunday.

title: Sinner dethrones Alcaraz in rematch at Wimbledon
content: Jannik Sinner defeated two-time defending champion Carlos Alcaraz 4-6, 6-4, 6-4, 6-4 on Sunday to win his first Wimbledon championship and reverse the result of their epic French Open final five weeks ago.

title: NFLPA leaders back director Howell amid reports
content: The NFLPA's executive committee, in a message sent to membership, expressed its support for executive director Lloyd Howell Jr. as it looks into issues reported by ESPN last week.

title: Sources: Mavs shutting down Flagg for summer
content: The Mavericks are shutting down Cooper Flagg for the remainder of the NBA summer league, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Clark, Fever ride record half past Bueckers, Wings
content: Caitlin Clark had 14 points and 13 assists as the Fever scored a franchise-record 64 points in the first half en route to a 102-83 victory against the Wings.

title: Pavelski wins Tahoe tournament; Barkley is 69th
content: Former NHL player Joe Pavelski won the American Century Championship on Sunday, closing with an eagle in a wire-to-wire victory in the celeb event.

title: Stalions: Knew most signals in 7 games with U-M
content: Ex-Michigan staffer Connor Stalions, who triggered an NCAA investigation into sign-stealing, says he knew almost every signal in seven games over two seasons.

title: 📷 Rockies' Holliday throwback on draft day
content: The franchise celebrated selecting the son of former Rockies player Matt Holliday in the MLB draft by posting baby pics of Ethan in Rockies gear.

title: How Clark, Fever dropped 100 points on Paige Bueckers' Wings
content: Behind 13 assists from Caitlin Clark, the Fever put five players in double figures and scored 64 first-half points.

title: The Jannik Sinner-Carlos Alcaraz rivalry is one for the ages
content: On Sunday, Sinner defeated Alcaraz for the Wimbledon title -- the latest in a back-and-forth rivalry that will continue to entertain.

title: Club World Cup triumph shows Chelsea can win the Premier League
content: Chelsea have been crowned world champions -- but only when they end their Premier League title drought will the Blues be able to say they are back where they expect to be.

title: WNBA awards tracker: Collier has company in MVP conversation; Bueckers takes over ROY race
content: Paige Bueckers has emerged as the top rookie, while MVP favorite Napheesa Collier has some competition.

title: Who are the NFL's best offensive tackles? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Who are the best offensive tackles in the NFL? We asked execs, coaches and scouts to rank their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: Shane van Gisbergen takes Sonoma to extend win streak
content: Shane van Gisbergen extended his winning streak to two straight and three victories in the past five weeks with a dominating run at Sonoma Raceway.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: England thrash Wales and avoid Germany, Spain in bracket
content: England thrashed Wales and landed on the easier side of the bracket, as France topped Group D. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: Liverpool remember Jota in emotional first friendly
content: Liverpool and Preston North End players, staff and supporters paid tribute to Diogo Jota during their preseason friendly on Sunday.

title: Gyökeres warned with fines after going on strike
content: Sporting CP president Frederico Varandas has insisted that Viktor Gyökeres will face fines after he went on strike Saturday, refusing to report to the club's preseason training.

title: Sources: FIFA omitted FIFPRO from welfare talks
content: FIFPRO was not invited to a summit meeting in New York between FIFA president Gianni Infantino and players' groups, sources have told ESPN.

title: Messi extends historic streak with 2 more goals
content: Lionel Messi extended his MLS-record streak of multigoal games as he scored twice in Inter Miami's win over Nashville.

title: Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC
content: FIFA President Gianni Infantino said stadiums with roofs will be used to ease concerns over severe weather at the 2026 Men's World Cup.

title: Not done yet: Cazorla, 40, inks new Oviedo deal
content: Santi Cazorla will be back in LaLiga next season after signing a new contract with newly promoted Real Oviedo.

title: LaLiga boss rejects Madrid plea to extend break
content: LaLiga president Javier Tebas rejected Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois' plea to postpone the team's 2025-26 league opener to give players time to rest following the Club World Cup.

title: Louis van Gaal 'no longer bothered by cancer'
content: Louis van Gaal has said he is "no longer bothered by cancer" and is keen for a return to the higher levels of the game.

title: Remembering Arthur Ashe's historic 1975 Wimbledon title
content: Stan Smith, Richard Evans and Chris Eubanks reflect on the 50th anniversary of Arthur Ashe's Wimbledon victory.

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: The unstoppable power of Jim Abbott's legacy
content: Abbott, who pitched in the majors with one hand, remains a beacon for families with unique struggles.

title: Why LeBron and the Lakers are stuck in limbo
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: Talor Gooch takes second title in three years at LIV Andalucia
content: Talor Gooch parlayed a 4-shot lead going into the day at LIV Golf Andalucia into a 1-shot tournament championship.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern turn to Trossard after Luis Diaz move stalls
content: Bayern Munich will turn to Arsenal forward Leandro Trossard if a move for Liverpool's Luis Díaz falls through. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: Pics: Shubhanshu Shukla And Crew Pose For Photos Ahead Of Homecoming
content: Shubhanshu Shukla and three crew members lifted off from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida on June 25. They docked with the space station on June 26. Weather permitting, their spacecraft will safely splash down on July 15.

title: Gujarat Man Among 3 Indians Kidnapped By Al Qaeda-Linked Group In Mali
content: Three Indian nationals, including a resident of Jaipur, a man from Telangana, and an engineer from Odisha, were kidnapped on July 1 in the West African nation of Mali.

title: 2 Women Shot Dead In Kentucky Church Shooting, Police Kills Suspect
content: A gunman killed two women at a church in Kentucky and shot and wounded a state trooper outside an airport on Sunday before police were able to shoot him to death, authorities said.

title: "Putin Talks Nice, Then Bombs Everybody": Trump To Send Patriots To Ukraine
content: President Donald Trump on Sunday said Washington would send Patriot air defense systems to Kyiv and hinted at new sanctions on Russia, once again voicing displeasure with Russian leader Vladimir Putin over Moscow's war in Ukraine.

title: Tight Security, Internet Suspended In Haryana's Nuh Ahead Of Brij Mandal Yatra
content: Authorities have imposed multiple restrictions and heightened security in Haryana's Nuh district to ensure the peaceful conduct of the Brij Mandal Jalabhishek Yatra scheduled for Monday, officials said.

title: Trump Says Gaza Talks Ongoing, Hopes To Get 'Straightened' Out Next Week
content: US President Donald Trump told reporters on Sunday that talks are ongoing over Israel's conflict in Gaza and he hopes for progress in the next week, even as ceasefire negotiations in Doha stalled.

title: Trader Lynched In Bangladesh, Attackers Dance On His Body
content: At least seven people have been arrested, and a nationwide combing operation was launched in Bangladesh on Sunday in connection with the killing of a scrap trader here, Home Affairs Adviser Lieutenant General (retd) Jahangir Alam Chowdhury said.

title: "Should I Speak In Marathi Or Hindi?" When PM Called Lawyer Ujjwal Nikam
content: Noted lawyer Ujjwal Nikam, who is among four persons nominated to Rajya Sabha by President Droupadi Murmu, on Sunday said PM Modi called him to inform the news.

title: "He's Not Educated": BJP Leader Slams Tejashwi Yadav For "Sootra" Remark
content: BJP leader Sanjay Jaiswal on Sunday criticised RJD's Tejashwi Yadav following his remarks over the claims that Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter lists for Bihar elections revealed names of people from Bangladesh, Nepal, and Myanmar.

title: Shivraj Chouhan Stops Convoy To Help Man Injured In Road Accident In Bhopal
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday stopped his convoy in Bhopal to assist a youth injured in a road accident and ensured he was rushed to hospital.

title: Small Steps To Big Results, How J&K Lt Governor Helped Victims Of Terror
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha today distributed 40 appointment letters to victims of terrorism.

title: Ink Attack On Maratha Outfit Leader Sparks Row, BJP Leader Allegedly Involved
content: Maratha outfit Sambhaji Brigade's state president, Pravin Gaikwad, was attacked with black ink during an event organised by the Fattesingh Education Institute and Sakal Maratha Samaj in Akkalkot, Solapur.

title: Probe Agency ED Arrests 2 In Money-Laundering Case Against Sahara Group
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Sunday said it has arrested two persons as part of a money-laundering probe against the Sahara Group and its linked entities.

title: "Bewildering": Tejashwi Yadav On Poll Body's Bihar Voter List Revision Claim
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday cast doubts over the Election Commission's claim that the special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar was progressing at a brisk pace and would be completed before the July 25 deadline.

title: 'Not Intimated Earlier': Siddaramaiah Wants Bridge Inauguration Postponed
content: Siddaramaiah urged Nitin Gadkari to postpone the inauguration of Sigandur bridge and the foundation stone laying ceremony of infrastructure projects at Sagara taluk in in Shivamogga on July 14.

title: Missing For 6 Days, Delhi University Student's Body Found In Yamuna River
content: A 19-year-old student of Delhi University who went missing six days ago has been found dead in the Yamuna River, the police said. The student, Sneha Debnath, was a resident of Tripura. Her family has identified her body, the police said.

title: Video: Swiggy Delivery Agent Assaulted On Busy Bengaluru Road
content: A Swiggy delivery executive was brutally assaulted by three unidentified men at a traffic signal near Modi Hospital Junction in Bengaluru late last night, showed a video in another disturbing case of road rage.

title: Karnataka Congress MLA Pitches Nitin Gadkari For PM, Cites RSS Age-Limit Remark
content: Karnataka Congress MLA Belur Gopalakrishna has suggested Union Minister Nitin Gadkari as the ideal successor to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, should he step down on turning 75 years of age.

title: How India's FGD Shift Will Cut Electricity Cost By 25-30 Paise Per Unit
content: The government's move to ease sulphur emission rules for most coal-fired power plants strikes a delicate balance between costs, climate and compliance and is expected to cut electricity costs by 25-30 paise per unit, officials said on Sunday.

title: Air India tragedy: Crash report a ‘cover-up’, say AI171 victims’ kin
content: Relatives of the Air India crash victims are denouncing the preliminary probe as a cover-up, alleging it protects the airline, Boeing, and the Indian government. Families are rejecting compensation offers and planning legal action, suspecting mechanical faults or maintenance issues rather than pilot error.

title: 'Talks beautifully, then bombs people': Trump calls out Putin; sanctions on Russia in works?
content: US President Donald Trump has criticized Vladimir Putin's attacks on Ukraine, following a major Russian airstrike. Trump indicated potential sanctions and confirmed the US will send Patriot air defense systems to Kyiv. He mentioned a deal where Nato would reimburse the US for the weapons. A major announcement is expected soon, signaling a possible shift in US policy towards Russia.

title: Watch: Plane crashes moments after takeoff at London airport; massive fireball caught on cam
content: A Zeusch Aviation plane, flight SUZ1, crashed shortly after takeoff from London Southend Airport on Sunday, prompting its closure. Operated by a Dutch company, the Beechcraft B200 Super King Air, equipped for medical transport, had arrived from Athens via Croatia. Witnesses reported a "big fireball" as the plane crashed head-first.

title: Schools shut, internet services suspended in Nuh: security tightened for Braj Mandal Yatra
content: In anticipation of the annual Braj Mandal Jalabhishek Yatra, authorities in Haryana's Nuh district have suspended mobile internet and bulk SMS services to prevent communal tension. Security measures include deploying 2,500 personnel, setting up checkpoints, and using drones and video cameras.

title: IND vs ENG: 'We never win...' - R Ashwin hits out at umpire Paul Reiffel
content: During the ongoing India-England Test series, Ravichandran Ashwin has voiced his discontent with umpire Paul Reiffel's decisions. Ashwin humorously recounted instances where he felt Reiffel's calls were consistently unfavorable to India, both while bowling and batting. He even shared his father's sentiment that India struggles to win when Reiffel officiates, adding fuel to the already intense rivalry.

title: Govt breaks silence on Chinese engineers leaving iPhone maker Foxconn’s plant
content: The Indian government is closely watching the departure of Chinese engineers from Foxconn, a major iPhone supplier, but believes Apple has solutions to maintain production. Despite concerns about potential disruptions to iPhone 17 production, Apple is increasing iPhone production in India, aiming for 60 million units this year, with eased component sourcing from China and government support through visa facilitation.

title: IND vs ENG : Washington Sundar – The penny stock turns multibagger at Lord's
content: Washington Sundar delivered a standout all-round performance at Lord’s, scoring a crucial 23 and bagging 4/22 with the ball to dent England’s batting. Trusted by successive Indian team managements, his value continues to grow, making him the unflashy but high-yield “multibagger” who delivers when it matters most.

title: 'B-2 pilots told me...': Trump credits himself for Iran strikes
content: Donald Trump claimed B-2 pilots involved in Operation Midnight Hammer told him no previous president dared order such a mission in Iran. He lauded the strike, aimed at eliminating Iranian nuclear weapons, as an overwhelming success, rating it a '15' out of 10.

title: Bihar poll survey finding illegal immigrants, say Election Commission sources
content: Bihar's electoral roll revision has reportedly uncovered illegal immigrants from Nepal, Bangladesh, and Myanmar attempting to register as voters using fraudulent documents. This claim has sparked political controversy, with RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav dismissing the reports as baseless.

title: US senators send ‘warning letter’ to Nvidia CEO JenSen Huang: ‘We are worried that…’
content: US senators cautioned Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang about his upcoming China trip. They urged him to avoid companies undermining US chip export controls. Concerns exist about potential circumvention of technology safeguards. Nvidia defended its technology as setting a global standard. Huang previously criticized US AI chip export restrictions. DeepSeek is allegedly assisting China's military, raising further concerns.

title: 'God alone saved me': Trump marks assassination attempt anniversary at Club World Cup Final - Watch
content: US President Trump attended the FIFA Club World Cup final at MetLife Stadium, where Chelsea triumphed over Paris Saint-Germain. He presented the trophy and medals, enjoying the match alongside FIFA President Gianni Infantino and other notable figures. Trump later reflected on the anniversary of an assassination attempt, praising first responders and expressing his commitment to the nation's restoration.

title: IND vs ENG 3rd Test: Ben Stokes mocks KL Rahul at Lord's - Watch
content: Tensions flared at Lord's as Ben Stokes mockingly applauded KL Rahul, mirroring Shubman Gill's earlier taunt towards Zak Crawley. This exchange intensified an already gripping Test match where India, chasing 193, ended Day 4 at 58 for 4 after losing Akash Deep to Stokes' final-ball strike.

title: Microsoft job cuts: Encourages employees after laying off 15,000
content: Microsoft is urging its remaining workforce to enhance their AI skills after significant layoffs impacting over 15,000 employees this year. The company is integrating AI usage into performance reviews and shifting its sales strategy towards technically proficient "solutions engineers." This move comes amidst substantial AI investments and a company-wide push for Copilot adoption.

title: Head of infrastructure engineering at Elon Musk’s AI company resigns
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: 'Life takes us in different directions': Saina announces separation from husband
content: Badminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have announced their separation after six years of marriage. Nehwal, an Olympic bronze medalist, shared the news on Instagram, citing a mutual decision for peace and growth. The couple, who trained together at the Pullela Gopichand Academy, married in 2018. Nehwal has been battling arthritis, impacting her training.

title: AAIB preliminary report: AI pilots' association lashes out at 'insinuation of suicide'
content: Following the AAIB's preliminary report on the Air India 171 crash, the ICPA has strongly condemned the speculation of pilot suicide. The union emphasized that pilots undergo rigorous screening and training, deeming such insinuations irresponsible and insensitive.

title: Stuntman SM Raju dies during Arya-Pa Ranjith film shoot
content: Tragedy struck the set of Arya and Pa. Ranjith's upcoming film as stunt artist SM Raju passed away during a car toppling stunt. Actor Vishal, deeply saddened by the loss of Raju, a long-time collaborator, expressed his condolences and pledged support to Raju's family. Tributes poured in from the film industry, with Stunt Silva also mourning the loss of the talented stunt performer.

title: 'Friendship is done': Swift unlikely to forgive Blake Lively after betrayal
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship faces trouble. Sources say they are not in contact. This follows Lively's connection to Justin Baldoni's legal issues. Lively's image suffered, straining the bond. Swift is now focused on Travis Kelce. Lively seeks new high-profile connections. The friendship may be over. Both are moving on with their careers and relationships.

title: Club World Cup: Cole Palmer shines as Chelsea crush PSG 3-0 to win title
content: Chelsea dominated Paris Saint-Germain in the Club World Cup final, securing a 3-0 victory fueled by Cole Palmer's outstanding performance. Palmer scored twice and assisted another goal, leading Chelsea to their second title in front of a large crowd that included Donald Trump. PSG's hopes for a quadruple were dashed as Chelsea displayed superior energy and tactical execution.

title: Himachal Pradesh: Orphaned in flash flood, 11-month-old gets world as cradle
content: Following a devastating cloudburst in Mandi district, 11-month-old Nikita was orphaned after her parents and grandmother were swept away. The community rallied around her, offering immense support and love. Despite numerous adoption offers, Nikita's relatives decided she will be raised by her paternal aunt, ensuring she remains within her family. A bank account has been opened to support Nikita's future.

title: “It’s in my DNA”: Ciara embraces New York spotlight as Russell Wilson begins fresh start with Giants
content: Ciara and Russell Wilson are making waves as they transition to New York City, with Wilson joining the Giants. Ciara expressed excitement about embracing the city's culture and educational opportunities for their children, highlighting her family's deep roots in New York. The move marks a significant new chapter for the couple, with Wilson's NFL comeback and Ciara's ventures.

title: Penguins quash Crosby trade rumors, vow to keep their captain
content: Amidst swirling trade rumors linking Sidney Crosby to teams like the Colorado Avalanche and Montreal Canadiens, the Pittsburgh Penguins have firmly stated their captain will not be traded. Despite speculation fueled by the Penguins' current standing and comments from some insiders, Crosby's agent and close friend have refuted the claims.

title: 'She deserves a great guy': Taylor Swift and Travis get Modern Family star’s approval
content: Eric Stonestreet, known from Modern Family, shares his views on Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's relationship. He supports their romance. Stonestreet has known Kelce for years. He believes Swift deserves a great partner. Stonestreet describes Kelce as an awesome and solid person. He is happy for both of them. This endorsement comes from a long-time friend and Chiefs fan.

title: Gisele Bündchen’s tearful interview: Healing after Tom Brady divorce
content: Gisele Bundchen spoke about her divorce from Tom Brady in March 2024. She described it as the death of her dream. Bundchen dismissed media claims that Brady's return to football caused the split. She expressed continued support for Brady's happiness and success. Bundchen is focusing on her own truth and has grown close to Joaquim Valente.

title: Ayesha Curry melts hearts: Baby Cai photo looks just like dad Stephen
content: Ayesha Curry recently shared a heartwarming photo of her youngest child, Cai, sparking a frenzy online due to the striking resemblance to his father, Steph Curry. Fans flooded social media, pointing out Cai's light eyes and infectious smile mirror those of the NBA superstar. Some even noted a resemblance to Steph's mother, Sonya Curry, highlighting the Curry family's strong genes.

title: CID 2 to soon go off-air amid low TRP?
content: CID's season 2, marked by Parth Samthaan's entry and Shivaji Satam's return, faces potential cancellation due to low TRP ratings, despite positive fan reactions to its plot twists and cast performances. Rumors suggest that 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' season 17 might replace it. While fans praise the show's suspenseful episodes, its future remains uncertain.

title: Wimbledon 2025: Sinner beats Alcaraz, clinches maiden Grand Slam on grass
content: Jannik Sinner secured his first Wimbledon title, defeating Carlos Alcaraz in four sets and avenging his recent French Open final defeat. This victory marks Sinner's fourth Grand Slam championship, closing the gap with Alcaraz (5) in total titles. The Italian's win ended Alcaraz's impressive 24-match winning streak and his dominance at Wimbledon, where he had won 20 consecutive matches.

title: Popularly prescribed pain drug can increase the risk of dementia by up to 40%, reveals study
content: A recent study by Case Western University reveals a concerning link between gabapentin, a common drug for nerve pain and epilepsy, and an increased risk of dementia and mild cognitive impairment. Researchers found that individuals prescribed gabapentin for lower back pain were significantly more likely to develop these cognitive issues within ten years, especially with frequent prescriptions. Read more below!

title: Ulfa-I claims 3 'big' casualties in 'India drone strikes' on Myanmar camps, Army denies operations
content: Ulfa-I claimed that three of its senior members were killed in drone attacks by the Indian Army in Myanmar's Sagaing region, but the Army has denied these claims. The outfit specified the attacks involved over 150 drones, resulting in casualties and injuries.

title: Punjab: 4 pose as Nihangs to kidnap woman, hijack car in Mohali; arrested within 10 hours
content: In Mohali, four men dressed as Nihangs abducted a woman and stole her car, abandoning her on Airport Road. Haryana Police swiftly responded, arresting the suspects within 10 hours at a gurdwara in Shahbad, recovering the stolen vehicle. The accused, including a granthi and others, planned to sell the car in Delhi.

title: From Covid to pneumonic plague: mRNA vaccine scores another win with 100% effectiveness
content: Scientists in Tel Aviv and IIBR have developed an mRNA vaccine. It combats the deadly Yersinia pestis bacterium. This bacterium causes plague. The vaccine showed 100% effectiveness in animal trials. It targets pneumonic plague. Yersinia pestis caused the Black Death. It remains a threat today. This breakthrough offers hope for a new defense. It addresses antibiotic resistance.

title: We Tibetans deeply indebted to India for warm hospitality: Dalai Lama
content: Marking his 90th birthday, the Dalai Lama expressed gratitude to India for its hospitality since 1959, indirectly addressing China's claim over Tibet. He highlighted India's role as the land of Buddha and its support in preserving Tibetan culture and education. A declaration at the conference lauded his stance on his reincarnation and spiritual integrity.

title: Odisha student warned of suicide in post days before self-immolation
content: A 20-year-old student in Balasore attempted self-immolation after alleging sexual harassment by a faculty member and inaction by the college. She posted on X about her plight, threatening suicide if justice wasn't served. Her father accuses the teacher and principal of tormenting her, leading to immense pressure and ultimately, her desperate act. She is currently battling severe burns.

title: Kolkata B-school rape probe hits wall as 'survivor', her advocate father won't speak
content: A psychologist's rape allegation against a student at a Kolkata management institute faces hurdles as the complainant and her family refuse to cooperate with the investigation. Despite forensic evidence collection and police efforts to gather information, the family's silence and a lack of engagement with authorities are impeding the probe.

title: From having legs hacked off to getting Rajya Sabha foothold: A Master's journey of grit
content: Prime Minister Modi nominated C Sadanandan Master, a victim of brutal political violence, to the Rajya Sabha. Sadanandan, whose legs were hacked off by CPM workers in 1994 for his RSS affiliation, exemplifies resilience. Despite the attack, he continued to advocate against violence and promote Hindutva.

title: Eye on China, India ramps up fertiliser cooperation with Saudi Arabia
content: India has secured a significant boost to its food security with long-term agreements signed between Saudi mining company Ma'aden and Indian firms IPL, KRIBHCO, and CIL. The deal ensures a supply of 3.1 million MT of DAP fertiliser annually for five years, potentially extending for another five.

title: Martyrs Day clampdown: ‘J&K govt under detention’ to prevent visits to graveyard
content: Authorities in J&K barred Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and other political figures from visiting the 1931 martyrs' graveyard in Srinagar, leading to widespread detentions and restrictions. Omar criticized the clampdown, likening the 1931 uprising to Jallianwala Bagh, while the BJP contested the narrative of martyrdom. The events highlight ongoing tensions and differing perspectives on Kashmir's history and political landscape.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ BO collection day 24: Film crosses Rs 160 cr mark
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia Deshmukh's film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' is a big hit. The sports drama earned Rs 3 crore on Sunday. Its domestic collection is now Rs 160.75 crore. The film stars neurodivergent actors. It is about a basketball coach training players with disabilities. The film faces competition from new releases like 'Metro..In Dino' and 'Superman'.

title: 'Solid batters in the dressing room': Sundar confident of Lord's win
content: India had seized control earlier in the day by bowling England out for just 192 in their second innings, with Sundar starring with a brilliant spell of 4 for 22. But the momentum shifted late in the day when England picked up three wickets in the space of 30 minutes, tilting the balance slightly in their favour.

title: Samosa, jalebi join cigarettes on health alert list
content: The health ministry is mandating "oil and sugar boards" in central institutions like AIIMS Nagpur to highlight hidden fats and sugars in common snacks. This initiative aims to combat the rising obesity crisis in India, where a significant portion of the population is projected to be overweight by 2050.

title: Residents of Patna await booth-level-officers as deadline for enumeration forms nears
content: Patna residents are anxious as booth-level officers (BLOs) haven't collected enumeration forms (EFs) before the July 25 deadline. Despite Election Commission claims of 80% collection, many like Raju Sinha and Munna Singh are still waiting.

title: Ties bitter, but Bangladesh mango diplomacy still sweet enough
content: Bangladesh continues its "mango diplomacy" by sending 1,000 kg of Haribhanga mangoes to PM Narendra Modi, a gesture of goodwill amidst recent political shifts. This tradition, initiated by former PM Sheikh Hasina, aims to strengthen ties between Dhaka and New Delhi.

title: J&K LG Manoj Sinha hands over job letters to kin of terror victims
content: The J&K government is actively working to dismantle the terror ecosystem while simultaneously supporting families victimized by terrorism. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha distributed job letters to the next-of-kin of terror victims, addressing past neglect and hardship. The scheme provides jobs, financial aid, FIR assistance, and property restoration, aiming to deliver justice and economic stability to affected families.

title: Shai Gilgeous‑Alexander smiles proudly; NBA Finals family session melts hearts
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander of the Oklahoma City Thunder had a dominant 2025 NBA season, balancing his basketball career with family life. His son, Ares Alexander, stole the show during the NBA Finals family portrait session, capturing hearts online.

title: Tibet issue a thorn in ties with India, says Chinese envoy
content: China's embassy in Delhi voiced strong objections to recent remarks from Indian figures regarding Tibet and the Dalai Lama's reincarnation. The spokesperson emphasized India's commitment to recognizing Tibet as part of China and preventing anti-China political activities by Tibetans in India.

title: 26/11 prosecutor, former foreign secretary, 2 others nominated to Rajya Sabha
content: President Droupadi Murmu nominated lawyer Ujjwal Nikam, retired diplomat Harsh Vardhan Shringla, RSS worker C Sadanandan Master, and historian Meenakshi Jain to the Rajya Sabha, filling vacancies that had been pending for nearly a year. Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised their contributions, highlighting Nikam's legal expertise, Shringla's diplomatic service, Master's resilience, and Jain's work in preserving cultural heritage.

title: 'Op Baam just the beginning': Baloch leader after major attacks on Pak army
content: The Baloch National Movement (BNM) declared that Balochistan will never be part of Pakistan, coinciding with the launch of "Operation Baam," a series of coordinated attacks by the Baloch Liberation Front (BLF) targeting the Pakistan army across key districts.

title: Maharashtra: Uddhav Sena's men trace & assault autowala over Marathi
content: After a video went viral showing an autorickshaw driver refusing to speak Marathi, a group of men, allegedly from Shiv Sena (UBT), assaulted him. The driver, Raju Patwa, was traced and forced to apologize for his defiance.

title: Nats take Eli Willits No. 1! 2025 MLB draft tracker live picks and analysis
content: day 1 of the 2025 MLB draft is in the books, with the Washington Nationals taking prep shortstop Eli Willits with the no. 1 overall pick . the los Angeles Angels followed up by college pitcher Tyler Bremner and the Seattle Mariners nabbed another in Kade Anderson at third .

title: Christian McCaffrey and Olivia Culpo announce birth of first child with joint post
content: Christian McCaffrey  and Olivia Culpo welcomed their first child. The  San Francisco 49ers  star running back and former Miss Universe announced the news in a joint Instagram post on Sunday. The black-and-white photo collage included images of the couple in the delivery room as well each of them cradling their baby. McCaffrey and Culpo  announced in March  that they were expecting. A post shared by Olivia Frances Culpo (@oliviaculpo) "Colette Annalise McCaffrey" the couple wrote together on Instagram. Culpo posted a photo of McCaffrey with their baby on her Instagram story, captioning it: "Colette is so lucky to have the best daddy in the world. A love like no other." She also added a photo of McCaffrey consoling Culpo while in the delivery room, writing: "The scariest and most rewarding of all experiences. As soon as he came into the room I felt most at peace." McCaffrey and Culpo  married in June 2024 .

title: Where Netherlands went wrong under Jonker in Euro 2025 failure
content: a 5-2 demolition job by France on Sunday summed up their disappointing tournament . the Dutch lost 4-0 to the french in their second match . but they conceded three goals in six minutes . it ended any slim hopes they had of salvaging their tournament in 2013 .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at TE, RB and Edge
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . we'll collect those names here as the top-10 for each position is revealed . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position, and in many cases all positions .

title: Shakur Stevenson showed that the fight in him is second to none
content: Shakur Stevenson beats William Zepeda to retain his WBC lightweight title . he was promoted to the co-main event of Ring Magazine 3 by Turki Alalshikh . the chairman of Saudi Arabia's general entertainment authority was elevated to the main event .

title: Klay Thompson fuels relationship rumors with Megan Thee Stallion
content: Klay Thompson's trip to the Bahamas led to the usual offseason vacation social media collage . rumors about the rapper's relationship started swirling after the rapper posted a photo on Instagram . in one slide, the rapper posed alongside someone, presumed to be Pete, facing away from the camera .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: CM Naidu expresses shock over Railway Kodur lorry accident
content: District Collector Sridhar Chamakuri briefed the Chief Minister on the tragic incident, informing that all the injured persons were under treatment

title: Jaishankar urges ‘continued normalisation’ of ties between India and China
content: Mr. Jaishankar also said the resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra is “widely appreciated in India”

title: Nine farm workers killed, 10 others injured after mango-laden lorry overturns near Railway Kodur
content: At the time of the mishap, the lorry was carrying an overload of mangoes of about 40 tonnes, with twenty workers seated on the top of it

title: Who are qualified as ‘ordinarily resident’? | Explained
content: What does Section 20 of the Representation of the People Act, 1950 state? Why are migrant workers vulnerable when it comes to classifying themselves as ordinarily resident in a particular constituency? Are NRIs allowed to vote? What does the Registration of Electors Rules, 1960 govern?

title: Radhika’s murder was pre-mediated, planned for three days, claims her friend Himaanshika
content: Her friend also claims Radhika “felt suffocated at home” with many restrictions as her parents were “orthodox” and “influenced by the opinion of others”

title: Singapore is at ‘heart’ of India's Act East Policy: Jaishankar
content: Mr. Jaishankar, who was in Singapore as part of his two-nation trip, also met President Tharman Shanmugaratnam and Deputy Prime Minister Gan Kim Yong

title: Not foreigners, Biharis will decide fate of Bihar: BJP
content: The criticism came the same day officials said that field agents of the Election Commission have found "a large number of people" from Nepal, Bangladesh and Myanmar in their house-to-house visits

title: Mobile Internet services suspended in Haryana’s Nuh for 24 hours ahead of Brij Mandal Jalabhishek Yatra
content: To prevent any untoward incidents, the district administration has banned carrying of any weapons, including licensed weapons, firearms, swords, sticks, tridents, rods, knives and chains

title: Climate change is changing where and how Indians are living
content: Climate migration, which is the movement of people forced to leave their homes due to climate-related disasters, has led to widespread and often involuntary migration to urban areas and other regions, eroding social structures and worsening living and working conditions for migrants

title: Kashmir-based Islamic bodies upset by Shia cleric Imran Ansari remarks, calls for boycott
content: In a joint statement, the MMU, headed by Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, said it was deeply anguished and strongly condemned deliberate provocations by Mr. Ansari.

title: Push for long duration operation against militants in the higher reaches of Kupwara
content: In a rare visit, Director General of Police Nalin Prabhat took stock at the remote yet strategically sensitive region of Lolab close to the Line of Control

title: U.P. estimates 60 million devotees will take part in Kanwar Yatra
content: The state said it is implementing a women-centric security model by deploying over 10,000 women police personnel along the Yatra route.

title: Centre appoints Abhijat Sheth as new NMC chairperson
content: Dr. Sheth, a cardiothoracic surgeon, said that his priority would be to improve quality of medical education, promoting good governance, and foster teamwork to achieve governmental objectives.

title: Three Trinamool leaders killed in four days; intra-party feuds suspected
content: Piyush Ghosh, zonal president of the TMC in Sainthia, was killed in the early hours of Sunday; TMC leaders Razzak Khan and Abul Kalam Azad were killed on Thursday

title: A riot of colour, devotion and drumbeats: Bonalu draws lakhs to Ujjaini Mahankali temple
content: A major highlight of the day’s festivities was the spirited performance by the Potharajus, bare-chested men daubed in turmeric and vermillion, dancing to the beat of traditional drums

title: T.N. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin requests Jaishankar to secure release of fishermen from Sri Lankan custody
content: In the early hours of July 13, seven fishermen from Rameswaram were arrested by the Sri Lankan authorities

title: Former Asia Pacific Correspondent of The Hindu, P.S. Suryanarayana, passes away
content: He had worked as a foreign correspondent from Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Singapore and the U.S.; he also taught at universities in Singapore after retirement

title: Southern Railway launches drive to ensure safety at non-interlocked level crossing gates
content: Gatekeepers known for unsafe working behaviour, including sleeping and alcohol consumption, to be banned

title: No urgent safety concern in Air India crash report: FAA
content: The U.S. regulator makes no new recommendation of safety measures for Boeing 787-8; it reminds counterparts of 2018 advisory on potential disengagement of lock on fuel switches on the aircraft

title: Step up efforts to declare Thirukkural a national book, says CM Stalin
content: Since Aryanism can’t claim Thiruvalluvar as its own, there have  been attempts to appropriate him by portraying him in saffron. Cheating is the appropriate word to describe this appropriation, the Chief Minister says, releasing a commentary on The Thirukkural authored by lyricist Vairamuthu

title: Nipah death in Palakkad leads to alert in six Kerala districts
content: Apart from Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode, Thrissur, Kannur and Wayanad districts have also been put on alert.

title: ‘U.S. donkey route’ case: ED probe reveals human traffickers used fake visas to send Indians abroad
content: During the searches so far, the ED says it has seized forged emigration stamps of various foreign countries, visa templates, various other related papers, and digital devices

title: Indian fertilizer majors sign deal with Saudi Arabia firm Ma’aden
content: The agreements will ensure supply of 3.1 million MT of DAP (Diammonium Phosphate) fertilizer per annum for five years from 2025-26 onwards

title: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla prepares to head back home
content: ‘Back from here, I carry with me a lot of memories, but one thing that really sticks to me is what humanity is capable of when all of us come together from different parts of the world and work for a common goal,’ the Indian astronaut said ahead of his return to Earth

title: Mamata Banerjee to lead protest in Kolkata on July 16 against targeting of migrants
content: Trinamool Congress to stage Statewide demonstrations amid reports of alleged harassment in BJP-ruled States

title: CCTV cameras to be fixed in 74,000 coaches: Railways
content: This will significantly improve safety of passengers, say officials; each coach will be equipped with four dome-type cameras placed at the entrance; cameras will be installed in 15,000 locomotives

title: A thunderous finale to the National Percussion Festival
content: The final day programmes began with a stunning performance of Pandi Melam by Peruvanam Kuttan Marar and ensemble

title: Kolkata police constitute SIT to probe into rape of women by student on IIM-C campus
content: A 26-year-old student has been booked and arrested based on a complaint by a mental health counsellor of rape on the campus. The police have sought the footage of CCTV inside the IIM-C premises

title: Micro-industries will be set up in each Assembly constituency for economic empowerment of women: Deputy CM Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka
content: Criticises BRS for abandoning interest-free loans for women, which were introduced by the successive Congress governments in the past; says the govt. has distributed interest-free loans worth ₹21,600 crore in the form of cheques to women’s SHGs in the first year itself

title: VinFast recruits 200 polytechnic students trained under Naan Mudhalvan skill development drive
content: Of the 344 students trained under the scheme, 304 appeared for the recruitment, and around 229 were short-listed. Based on other criteria, 200 were recruited for the company, says Thoothukudi Collector K. Elambahavath

title: Ramesh Chennithala alleges massive irregularities in Anert solar projects, demands audit and probe by Assembly panel
content: The Congress leader cites instances where price differences of as much as 50% have occurred in the implementation of solar power projects of comparable capacity through different private firms.

title: Andhra Pradesh Energy Minister Gottipati Ravi Kumar rules out hike in power tariffs
content: Accusing the previous YSRCP government of failing to generate a single megawatt during its term, the Minister says that the NDA dispensation is focused on promoting large-scale green energy projects, particularly in the Rayalaseema region

title: Tamil film stunt trainer dies during shoot for Pa Ranjith’s film in Nagapattinam
content: Stunt trainer Mohanraj, 52 collapses and dies during the shoot for a Tamil film, starring Arya and directed by Pa Ranjith, say reports. Investigation underway by Keelaiyur police

title: New bus terminus at Panjapur will become operational from July 16, says Minister
content: Tender for operation and maintenance of the terminus has been finalised and the chosen company will pay ₹50 lakh a year to the Corporation and get the right to collect rent from shops and entry fee from bus operators

title: Residents raise alarm over neglected PHC and PWD quarters in Jeevan Bima Nagar
content: Broken furniture, bags of cement, and abandoned vehicles clutter the premises of PHC and PWD quarters

title: 14 held in EAGLE decoy operation in Gachibowli
content: One of the customers came with his wife and four-year-old son. In another case, a couple who attempted to buy marijuana tested positive.

title: Raj Bhavan, Kerala government set for another face-off over foot worship at schools
content: Governor says ‘gurupuja’ is an integral part of Indian society and if such practices are set aside, the very existence of society will be affected. Education Minister Sivankutty says directives are being issued to all school authorities that no student in any school in Kerala should be made to wash the feet of teachers or anyone else

title: Government ready to clear doubts regarding revised timing in high schools: V. Sivankutty
content: Current objections against time revision were suspicious given that similar revisions in the past were not met with protests or disputes, says Minister

title: Monsoon treks near Visakhapatnam: Explore scenic Eastern Ghats trails
content: Monsoon treks near Visakhapatnam lead explorers into remote terrains shaped by Nature and guided by indigenous knowledge

title: Tirupati MLA lauds services of Reach Global Foundation
content: Appealing to everyone to help the poor under the P4 programme, District Collector S. Venkateswar announces that he has adopted five families from Nakkala Colony

title: Bihari migrants in Bengaluru are in dilemma over SIR
content: Many said travelling back home to submit documents for Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls is not practical at this point in time

title: A.P. Space Policy aims at attracting investments of ₹25,000 crore in next 10 years
content: Leveraging on Central government’s National Space Programme, the State government intends to create an inclusive ecosystem for space sector participants, including start-ups, large enterprises, academic institutions, and global investors

title: India joins bilateral military exercise in Australia
content: Talisman Sabre exercise, now in its 11th iteration, brings together more than 35,000 military personnel from 19 nations

title: Youth Congress locks horns with veteran Congress leader P.J. Kurien
content: Kurien says Youth Congress leaders are seen only on television and are absent from ground-level struggles, contrasting them with SFI members who align with ‘disaffected youth.’ The comments draw strong reactions from Youth Congress State president and other leaders
